section.heading: Course of sexual conduct against a child in the first degree

content.p:
he or she engages in two or more acts of sexual conduct, which
includes at least one act of vaginal sexual contact, oral sexual
contact, anal sexual contact or aggravated sexual contact, with a child
less than eleven years old; or

he or she, being eighteen years old or more, engages in two or
more acts of sexual conduct, which include at least one act of vaginal
sexual contact, oral sexual contact, anal sexual contact or aggravated
sexual contact, with a child less than thirteen years old.
 2. A person may not be subsequently prosecuted for any other sexual
offense involving the same victim unless the other charged offense
occurred outside the time period charged under this section.
 Course of sexual conduct against a child in the first degree is a
class B felony.
